---
title: "Dashboards and Shiny"
output: 
  flexdashboard::flex_dashboard:
    orientation: columns
    vertical_layout: fill
runtime: shiny
---
```{r setup, include=FALSE}
library(flexdashboard)
library(tidyverse)
library(plotly)
library(shiny)

dat<-read_csv(url("https://www.dropbox.com/s/4ebgnkdhhxo5rac/cel_volden_wiseman%20_coursera.csv?raw=1"))

dat$Party<-recode(dat$dem,`1`="Democrat",`0`="Republican")


#######HINT: for Chart D, you'll need to set the height of the renderPlot, using the height argument. Try a value of 750.


```


Page 1
======

### Chart A


```{r}
charta <- dat %>% 
  drop_na() %>%
  filter(year>1979) %>%
  group_by(year,Party)  %>%
  summarise(passed=sum(all_pass))
  
ggplot(charta,
       mapping = aes(x = year,
                     y = passed,
                     fill = Party)) +
  geom_area() +
  labs(title = "Number of Bills Passed Since 1980",
       x = "Year",
       y = "All Bills Passed") +
  scale_fill_manual(values = c("blue","red"))

```


Page 2 {data-orientation=columns}
======

Column
------- 

### Chart B

```{r}

(dat%>%
  drop_na()%>%
  filter(congress==110) %>%
  ggplot(aes(x = votepct,
             y = all_pass,
             color = Party)) +
  geom_point() +
  geom_smooth() +
  scale_color_manual(values = c("blue","red")) +
  labs(title = "Passage and Vote Pct., 110th Congress",
       x = "Vote Pct.",
       y = "All Pass")) %>%
  ggplotly()
           
```

### Chart D

```{r}

choice <- selectInput(inputId="my_state",
            label="state",
            choices=sort(unique(dat$st_name)),
            multiple=TRUE,
            selected=unique(dat$st_name))
choice

```
Column
------

```{R}
renderPlot(
  dat %>% 
    group_by(st_name) %>% 
    filter(congress==110) %>%
    summarise(passed=sum(all_pass))%>%
    ggplot(
      aes(x=passed,
          y=st_name)) +
      geom_bar(stat="identity") +
      labs(title="Total Bills Passed by State Delegations, 110th Congress",
           x="Total Bills Passed Per State",
           y="State Name") +
    scale_x_continuous(expand = c(0, 0)),
  height = 750
  
)

```
